title: Unit 2 Checkpoint: Derivatives — Definition & Basic Rules
description: Summative checkpoint assessing the derivative definition (limit of difference quotient), basic differentiation rules (power, constant, sum/difference, trig, exp, ln), derivative interpretation as slope and rate, and derivative estimation from graphs and tables.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: f'(x) = lim_{h→0} [f(x+h)−f(x)]/h; expand, simplify, cancel h, then evaluate limit; alternate form f'(a) = lim_{x→a} [f(x)−f(a)]/(x−a)
Power rule nxⁿ⁻¹, rewrite radicals/fractions as fractional/negative exponents first; d/dx[sin]=cos, d/dx[cos]=−sin, d/dx[eˣ]=eˣ, d/dx[ln x]=1/x
f'(a) = slope of tangent at x=a = instantaneous rate of change; tangent line: y−f(a) = f'(a)(x−a); units of f' = units of f / units of x
Symmetric difference quotient [f(a+h)−f(a−h)]/(2h); not differentiable at corners, cusps, vertical tangents, discontinuities; differentiable ⇒ continuous (not converse)

assessmentProblems.question: Use the limit definition to find f'(x) if f(x) = 3x² − 5x.
Use the alternate form of the derivative to find f'(4) if f(x) = √(2x + 1).
Find the equation of the tangent line to f(x) = x³ − 2x at x = 2.
A particle moves along a line with position s(t) = t³ − 6t² + 9t + 1 (in meters, t in seconds). Find the velocity and acceleration at t = 2. Is the particle speeding up or slowing down at t = 2?
assessmentProblems.answer: v(t) = s'(t) = 3t²−12t+9. v(2) = 12−24+9 = −3 m/s. a(t) = v'(t) = 6t−12. a(2) = 12−12 = 0 m/s². Since a(2)=0, the particle is neither speeding up nor slowing down at that instant.

assessmentProblems.question:
Given the table:
| x | 1.0 | 1.5 | 2.0 | 2.5 | 3.0 |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| f(x) | 4.2 | 5.1 | 6.5 | 8.3 | 10.7 |
Estimate f'(2.0) using the symmetric difference quotient.
At which of the following is f NOT differentiable? (i) A corner (ii) A cusp (iii) A removable discontinuity (iv) A vertical tangent. Explain why for each.
assessmentProblems.answer: f is NOT differentiable at ALL four. (i) Corner: left and right derivatives are different (limit DNE). (ii) Cusp: slopes approach +∞ from one side and −∞ from the other. (iii) Removable discontinuity: f is not continuous, and differentiability requires continuity. (iv) Vertical tangent: slope is undefined (±∞).

assessmentProblems.question:
ANALYSIS: The function f is differentiable. Given: f(3) = 7, f'(3) = −2.
(a) Write the equation of the tangent line to f at x = 3.
(b) Use the tangent line to approximate f(3.1).
(c) If f''(3) > 0, is your approximation in (b) an overestimate or underestimate? Justify.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) y − 7 = −2(x − 3) → y = −2x + 13. (b) f(3.1) ≈ −2(3.1) + 13 = −6.2 + 13 = 6.8. (c) Underestimate. Since f''(3) > 0, f is concave up near x = 3. The tangent line lies below a concave-up curve, so the linear approximation underestimates the true value.
